intro: Indigofera mossambicensis, commonly known as African indigo, is a flowering plant belonging to the legume family, Fabaceae. It is native to tropical Africa and is characterized by its climbing habit and compound leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to purple, depending on the variety. Its seeds are encased in elongated pods, and the plant is known for its ability to fix nitrogen in the soil, making it valuable in agricultural settings. Indigofera mossambicensis has also been used traditionally for dyeing textiles due to its rich pigments.
